page.title: 15MARES & FOALS ON THE STUD
page.content: In the spring and early summer, the five mares are sent away to mate because there are no stallions on{Hare {Park}Stud Farm. If they are not in foal, they go back to the same stallion. The last day that they can be covered or mated is 15th.July. The gestation period of a horse is eleven months. Most of the foals are born between March and April. This is the best time for them to be born because there is plenty of fresh young grass for them. The foals stay at the stud until they are 'yearlings'.(All racehorses have their birthday on the same day (January 1st.) irrespective of when their real birthday is _ this is because there are special races for two-year-olds, three-year-olds etc.)
